逆.definition: contrary; opposite; backwards; to go against; to oppose; to betray; to rebel

逆來順受.definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it; to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc

逆倫.definition: unnatural relationship (parricide, incest etc); unfilial conduct; against social morals

逆商.definition: (psychology) adversity quotient (abbr. for 逆境商數|逆境商数[ni4jing4 shang1shu4])

逆天.definition: (literary) to be in defiance of the natural order; (coll.) extraordinary; incredible

逆斷層.definition: reverse fault (geology); compression fault, where one block pushes over the other at dip of less than 45 degrees

逆水行舟.definition: lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom); fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)

逆水行舟，不進則退.pinyin: ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4
逆水行舟，不進則退.definition: like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)

逆流.definition: against the stream; adverse current; a countercurrent; fig. reactionary tendency; to go against the trend

逆流溯源.definition: to go back to the source

逆流而上.definition: to sail against the current; (fig.) to go against the flow

逆生長.definition: to seem to grow younger; to regain one's youthful looks

逆耳.definition: unpleasant to hear; grates on the ear (of home truths)

逆耳之言.definition: speech that grates on the ear (idiom); bitter truths; home truths (that one does not want to hear)

逆行.definition: to go the wrong way; to go against one-way traffic regulation

逆行倒施.definition: to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong; to try to turn back history; a perverse way of doing things

逆襲.definition: to counterattack; to strike back; (neologism c. 2008) (of an underdog) to go on the offensive; to make an improbable comeback

逆風.definition: to go against the wind; contrary wind; a headwind
